@scopatz Add Mike McConnell to the edu show, if he wants to do it...
Regarding reproducibility in science, Jarrod Millman is chairing a session on this at the SIAM conference this Friday: http://meetings.siam.org/sess/dsp_programsess.cfm?SESSIONCODE=11844
@pwang Yeah, Jarrod is definitely on the list of people to mine.

I'd bet Luiz Ibanez at Kitware would be happy to do the show on reproducibility. He is a giant reproducibility advocate (and founder of the insight journal http://www.insight-journal.org/). Once there is a date set let me know and I'll ask him.

3 show ideas:
1. Embedded Systems Conference San Jose 2011
2. The Bay Area Maker Fair
3. Designing digital data filters
On that show should be Cameron Neylon and Kaitlin Thaney, again.
A show on managing software projects.

We should probably do a show on Japan, the tsunami, the nuclear reactors, etc. 

Obviously, Katy and myself should be on this one.  Do we know any strongly anti-nuclear people?
I'd love to have a debate about open access journals
@scopatz Add Jeff to the financial show
A show on managing software projects would be broad... how about one or more slightly more focused shows. Something on the order of "Content Management Systems".

@scopatz I think any talk of japan should be strictly related to computational issues (analog control redundancy, etc.?). I'd be willing, though I don't know if I really have much desire to seek out a conversation with strongly anti-nuclear people at this particular moment.
@katyhuff Oops, my terms were too broad.  I guess I meant more a show on "Managing software developers" (ie personalities) ~_~.

@katyhuff Yeah, I understand.  I was hoping for an enlightened conversation rather than the drivel that the standard news media is feeding us.  

I keep thinking that I don't really understand what the term "Partial Meltdown" means.  It seems to be the open set (0, 100) percent....
